critique:
The document expresses sympathy for Mrs. Sweeney and aims to evoke a sense of compassion and support for her situation. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are likely joy (for Mrs. Sweeney's well-being), sadness (for her loss), and perhaps a touch of surprise (at the unusual nature of the appointment). Disgust, fear, and anger are unlikely to be intended emotions.

Initial scores:
Joy: 7 (relief and happiness for Mrs. Sweeney)
Sadness: 6 (sympathy for her loss)
Surprise: 3 (unusual appointment)
Disgust: 1 (not applicable)
Fear: 1 (not applicable)
Anger: 1 (not applicable)
